name: Sanguinaria
Relationship: Complementary: TART. EM.Compare: JUSTICIA (bronchial catarrh, coryza, hoarseness; oversensitive). DIGITALIS (Migraine). BELL.; IRIS; MELI.; LACH.; FERR.; OP.

Head: Headaches return at climacteric; every seventh day
Veins and temples are distended
Burning in eyes
Periodical sick headache; pain begins in occiput, spreads upwards, and settles over eyes, especially right
Pain in small spot over upper left parietal bone
Worse right side, sun headache
Pain in the back of head like a flash of lightning
Pain better lying down and sleep
Respiratory: Hemoptysis from suppressed menses
Cough returns with every fresh cold
Sudden stoppage of catarrh of air passages brings on diarrhoea
Burning soreness in right chest, through to right shoulder
Oedema of larynx
Offensive breath and purulent expectoration
Asthma with stomach disorders
Tickling behind sternum, causes a constant hacking cough; worse at night on lying down
Cough, with burning pain in chest; worse, right side
Severe dyspnoea and constriction of chest
Trachea sore
Valvular disease with lung development, phosphates in urine and loss of flesh
Spasmodic cough after influenza and after whooping-cough
Severe soreness under right nipple
Cough of gastric origin; relieved by eructation
Pneumonia; better, lying on back
Aphonia
Burning in chest as of hot steam from chest to abdomen
Must sit up in bed
Sputum tough, rust-colored, offensive, almost impossible to raise
Fibroid phthisis
Heat and tension behind the sternum
Stomach: Spitting up of bile; gastroduodenal catarrh
Face: Neuralgia; pain extends in all directions from upper jaw
Fullness and tenderness behind angle of jaws
Nose: Ozaena, with profuse, offensive yellowish discharges
Chronic rhinitis; membrane dry and congested
Skin: Circumscribed red spots over malar bones
Red, blotchy eruptions; worse in spring
Burning and itching; worse by heat
Throat: Ulceration of mouth and fauces, with dry, burning sensation
Extremities: Rheumatic pains in places least covered by flesh; not in joints
Toes and soles of feet burn
Rheumatism of right shoulder, left hip-joint and nape of neck
Right-sided neuritis; better touching the part

details: Is a right-sided remedy pre-eminently, and affects chiefly the mucous membranes, especially of the respiratory tract. It has marked vasomotor disturbances, as seen in the circumscribed redness of the cheeks, flashes of heat, determination of blood to head and chest, distention of temporal veins, burning in palms and soles, and has been found very applicable to climacteric disorders. BURNING sensations, like from hot water. Influenzal coughs. Phthisis. SUDDEN STOPPING OF CATARRH OF RESPIRATORY TRACT FOLLOWED BY DIARRHOEA. BURNING in various parts is characteristic.
dosage: Tincture in headaches; sixth potency in rheumatism.
